BL.content: Freud: “creative sense of guilt” [compare to Nietzsche’s creative slave morality]
BL.linkedContent: Freud: “creative sense of guilt” [compare to Nietzsche’s creative slave morality]

FSW.content: for both Freud & Nietzsche, psychē requires difference in exertion of forces, no breaching w/out difference
FSW.linkedContent: for both Freud & Nietzsche, psychē requires difference in exertion of forces, no breaching w/out difference

PSSS.content: acc. Nietzsche & Freud, psychic cruelty always inventing new resources: cruelty of psyche, state of soul, still of the living, but a non-bloody cruelty [Grausamkeit]
PSSS.linkedContent: acc. Nietzsche & Freud, psychic cruelty always inventing new resources: cruelty of psyche, state of soul, still of the living, but a non-bloody cruelty [Grausamkeit]

PSSS.content: for Nietzsche & Freud, only differences of intensity, modality, quality, w/ in a same cruelty
PSSS.linkedContent: for Nietzsche & Freud, only differences of intensity, modality, quality, w/ in a same cruelty

DST.content: signature interrupts, or rather marks w/ incision, the fold along which metaphysical ontomimetology is destined to divide, desist [ontomimetology in Plato, Aristotle, Hegel, Heidegger, and more surreptitiously in Nietzsche, Freud, Lacan]
DST.linkedContent: signature interrupts, or rather marks w/ incision, the fold along which metaphysical ontomimetology is destined to divide, desist [ontomimetology in Plato, Aristotle, Hegel, Heidegger, and more surreptitiously in Nietzsche, Freud, Lacan]

SPEC.content: what is the child’s debt in a play w/out debt? on what w/out debt does play speculate in secret? what is the place of such a secret? [re: Freud’s debt to Nietzsche]
SPEC.linkedContent: what is the child’s debt in a play w/out debt? on what w/out debt does play speculate in secret? what is the place of such a secret? [re: Freud’s debt to Nietzsche]

SPEC.content: if one’s [intellectual] debt is always another’s, one is acquitted & guilty in advance? comment spéculer sur la dette d’un autre à soi revenant (amounting to, coming back to oneself)?
SPEC.linkedContent: if one’s [intellectual] debt is always another’s, one is acquitted & guilty in advance? comment spéculer sur la dette d’un autre à soi revenant (amounting to, coming back to oneself)?

SPEC.content: Nietzsche achieved findings of psychoanalysis w/out pain, using counterfeit coins [?] Freud’s évitement, avertissement
SPEC.linkedContent: Nietzsche achieved findings of psychoanalysis w/out pain, using counterfeit coins [?] Freud’s évitement, avertissement

SPEC.content: Nietzsche dared to link debt to the unconscious, a debt to that which one feels in advance acquitted, the debt of another that comes back to torment you
SPEC.linkedContent: Nietzsche dared to link debt to the unconscious, a debt to that which one feels in advance acquitted, the debt of another that comes back to torment you

SPEC.content: for Freud, one can inherit conceptual simulacra, counterfeit money [Nietzsche, Schopenhauer], but it is lacking in guaranteed value of psychoanalysis > Freud’s rationalization, his naive self-assurance re: counterfeit money, a scene of intolerable inheritance
SPEC.linkedContent: for Freud, one can inherit conceptual simulacra, counterfeit money [Nietzsche, Schopenhauer], but it is lacking in guaranteed value of psychoanalysis > Freud’s rationalization, his naive self-assurance re: counterfeit money, a scene of intolerable inheritance

SPEC.content: death impels (pousse) the pas d’écriture: but de la vie, but sans but, stratégie sans finalité du vivant > Nietzsche’s no conservation, and life a rare genus of that which is dead
SPEC.linkedContent: death impels (pousse) the pas d’écriture: but de la vie, but sans but, stratégie sans finalité du vivant > Nietzsche’s no conservation, and life a rare genus of that which is dead

SPEC.content: Freud’s “perpetual recurrence of the same thing”: phantom of demonic, conjured up cadentially, limping (boiteux) devil
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s “perpetual recurrence of the same thing”: phantom of demonic, conjured up cadentially, limping (boiteux) devil

SPEC.content: if something is avoided w/ so much insistence, must be a tendency, a temptation, envy [re: Freud’s avoidance of Nietzsche]
SPEC.linkedContent: if something is avoided w/ so much insistence, must be a tendency, a temptation, envy [re: Freud’s avoidance of Nietzsche]

SPEC.content: power (posts) as transcendental predicate (not to be confused w/ death drive or repetition compulsion, gives us w/ what to describe them) > still, though borrowing descriptive traits from Bemächtigung, death drive & repetition compulsion overflow power > there is only differance of power, whence the posts, “will to power” [?]
SPEC.linkedContent: power (posts) as transcendental predicate (not to be confused w/ death drive or repetition compulsion, gives us w/ what to describe them) > still, though borrowing descriptive traits from Bemächtigung, death drive & repetition compulsion overflow power > there is only differance of power, whence the posts, “will to power” [?]

SPEC.content: fort:da, pleasure is a kind of rhythm [Nietzsche], SPEC will have played fort:da of Nietzsche, the limping (boitement) of unterwegs, a step forward for nothing, only rhythm
SPEC.linkedContent: fort:da, pleasure is a kind of rhythm [Nietzsche], SPEC will have played fort:da of Nietzsche, the limping (boitement) of unterwegs, a step forward for nothing, only rhythm

SPEC.content: for Nietzsche, pain is not in opposition to pleasure, will to suffer constitutes very aspiration of will to power [?] > would beyond the PP, for Nietzsche, be affirmation of life rather than return to inorganic [?]
SPEC.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, pain is not in opposition to pleasure, will to suffer constitutes very aspiration of will to power [?] > would beyond the PP, for Nietzsche, be affirmation of life rather than return to inorganic [?]

SPEC.content: Nietzsche [Will To Power (699)]: one does not react to pain, it causes one to take a step
SPEC.linkedContent: Nietzsche [Will To Power (699)]: one does not react to pain, it causes one to take a step
